intro: Anacampseros subinclusa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers that often resemble insects. The plant features narrow, upright leaves that are typically covered in a whitish wax, which helps reduce water loss. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often blooming in spring. Anacampseros subinclusa is well adapted to arid environments and is often found growing on rocky outcrops.
